column4: pelo these are Dell Computers what I have heard are the hardest ones to get a Dual Boot to work with Windows/linux
it doesn't really matter what brand the computer is
I've never heard of a Dell computer that doesn't allow you to change boot order, and that's really all you need so you can install ubuntu
thats one thing I will not do is change the boot order in bios
erm, any reason for that?
I am confused alittle
well I am trying to get grub to boot from windows boot loader
when I try to load file ubuntu.bin or bootsect.lnx all I get is GRUB and frezzes
that's over my head, sorry
and I used sudo dd if=/dev/sdb of=/home/username/Desktop/ubuntu.bin bs=512 count=1
do you have an Idea how I can get windows to boot grub?
no, i did it the other way
i have grub boot windows
I have went that way and windows gave me sh** fits about it
I just installed Ubuntu first, then installed windows, then re-wrote grub and chainloaded to windows XP
that also lets me hibernate windows, since it goes to grub first and won't force me to resume my hibernation
well I don't use hybernation and windows I use it more often than linux
regardless, i find it easier just to install grub and chainload windows xp
I use linux to play some games and other project
I have switched to linux full-time now, windows is only for games and some windows only apps i need for work
well I am looking the other way so when windows does need to be reinstalled all I have to do is add the line to the bootloader then I get linux back
I personally would find it easier to reinstall grub, all you have to do is run grub, root (hdX,Y), setup (hdX)
otherwise you have to re-find the ubuntu.bin file again don't you?
I keep a copy on my external HD
